title: suboptimal span for tait non-defining use caused by using the same param twice

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code

```Rust
#![feature(type_alias_impl_trait)]

trait Trait {
    fn new() -> Self;
}

type Alias<T: Trait, U: Trait> = impl Trait;

fn foo<T: Trait, U: Trait>() -> Alias<T, U> {
    let a: T = foo::<T, T>();
    U::new()
}
```


### Current output

```Shell
error: non-defining opaque type use in defining scope
  --> src/lib.rs:10:16
   |
10 |     let a: T = foo::<T, T>();
   |                ^^^^^^^^^^^^^
   |
note: type used multiple times
  --> src/lib.rs:7:12
   |
7  | type Alias<T: Trait, U: Trait> = impl Trait;
   |            ^         ^
```


### Desired output

```Shell
error: non-defining opaque type use in defining scope
  --> src/lib.rs:10:16
   |
10 |     let a: T = foo::<T, T>();
   |                      ^  ^ type used multiple times here
   |
```


### Rationale and extra context

The current span is silly it says  "type used multiple" times and then points to a place other than where we are using a type multiple times, its not even the span of the type parameter we're using twice.
